instead of that labourious way you did for finding the inverse of a 3x3 you can just create an augmented matrix with A and its identity like [A | I], then row reduce until the identity matrix is on the left side, the matrix on the right side is the inverse of A.
how did they go?

It is possible to use GJE on this matrix.  Here are the steps: R2 := R2 - 3*R1 R1: = R1 + R2/5 R3:= R3 - 5*R1 R2 := R2/-10 R3:= R3 - 3*R2 R3:=R3*2/7 R2:= R2 - R3/2  The inverse ends up being: [2/5, 1/5, 0] [5/7, 0, -1/7] [-29/35, -1/5, 2/7]  When I first tried it, I ended up making the 3rd entry of the 3rd row equal to zero, which led me astray.  There was still a second entry in this row, so I didn't eliminate the row completely, which is a sign that either two rows are redundant or contradictory (which wasn't the case).   If this ever happens, where you eliminate the wrong entry of the row (but one of the other entries still remains), just swap two rows, so the last entry standing is in the correct place.

I can confirm that I got the same method with the method of minors, cofactors, adjuncts and determinants.  As long as the original matrix's determinant is not zero, you can always use this method to find its inverse.
That's the determinant of a 2x2 matrix; go back and watch Dave's previous video on evaluating determinants if you're stuck.

Hey fam, I hope that you and your loved ones are well. I would like to ask you the most important question ever asked:    Who is  Jesus? Not who is He to you. Rather, who is He really?   Jesus is the Son of God, who came to the world as a man. He lived a perfect and sinless life . Even though He was perfect and sinless, on the cross of Calvary God wrathfully punished Him for the sins of the world. 3 days later He rose from death. Now He is seated at the right hand of God, ruling as King over Heaven and Earth. On the judgment day He will judge you, me and every human being that has ever lived. Those who believed in Him will enter eternal joy with Him, but those who did not believe in Jesus will be sent to eternal condemnation.    So turn from your sins and believe in the Jesus. Believe and hope that you can be forgiven for all your sins because of His death and resurrection. He took your place in Hell, so that if you submit to Him as your Lord and God, you can be forgiven and take His place in heaven- you will be made sinless and perfect before the Holy Father. He'll also give you a new heart and mind that can love and obey Him.    Jesus lives so that you can have true life and freedom, and most importantly so that you can have an eternally peaceful relationship with God.  You are dead, and Jesus is your only Hope of life by reading The Bible. Start in Matthew, and try and read it through to The book of Revelation. Spend at least 15 minutes in a private place to read it. Read the Bible over and over again. The Creator of The universe, nature and all creation, has made Himself more clearly known through The Bible, as it is the only perfect, unchanging and authoritative revelation of God. You know there is an Almighty and Glorious God when you look at the universe and nature, but you can only know who He is by reading the Bible.   Bible link for YOU: https://my.bible.com/bible/111/MAT.1.NIV   Acts 15:11 ”On the contrary, we believe it is through the grace of the Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are." Ephesians 1:7 ”In Him, we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of His grace" Ephesians 2:8 ”For it is by grace you have been saved through faith, and this not from yourselves; it is the gift of God,” John 11:25-26: "Jesus said to her, 'I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die; and whoever lives by believing in me will never die. Do you believe this?' 1 Corinthians 6:14: "And God raised the Lord and will also raise us up by his power." Romans 6:9: "We know that Christ, being raised from the dead, will never die again; death no longer has dominion over him."  https://bible.knowing-jesus.com/topics/Christ-Is-Lord Source: https://bible.knowing-jesus.com/topics/Christ-Overcoming  Revelations 19:16 "And on His robe and on His thigh He has a name written, “KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.”   Acts 10:36  "The word which He sent to the sons of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ (He is Lord of all)" John 16:33 "I have told you all this so that you may have peace in me. Here on earth you will have many trials and sorrows. But take heart, because I have overcome the world.”

I think he meant it’s not just dividing each element with the corresponding element of another matrix ( a/b ), that’s how I interpreted that line

One could think of an inverse matrix as being similar to a "matrix division". But there are reasons why we often don't think of it as division. For one, there are plenty of matrices which don't have inverses. But more importantly, matrix multiplication is not commutative. So we would need to make sense of "dividing on the left" and "dividing on the right" - because what side you do things on matters. And we don't typically think of division as being "sided".

Good question.  The upper-left entry is always positive, and the main diagonal is always positive.  So for a 4x4 matrix, the pattern is: [ +, -, +, -] [ -, +, -, +] [ +, -, +, -] [ -, +, -, +]
Literally, why is formats and teaching styles like this not the norm.

6 = 2x3 - 1x0 cross out a capital T for this space   and then calculate the determinant |~ ~ ~| |2  ~  1| |0  ~  3|  find the determinant 2x3 - 1x0   6   -   0        6  so that gives you the matrix of minors |~ 6 ~| |~ ~ ~| |~ ~ ~|  and then negate it for the matrix of cofactors | ~ -6 ~| |-~ ~ -~| | ~ ~  ~|  and then reflect it for the adjoint |~ -~ ~| |-6 ~ -~| |~ -~ ~|

yes

Yes.  GJE is generally a more computationally-efficient method if you are given a matrix where the rows are easy to reduce, if you can find the right path through the row operations.  The method of minors, cofactors and determinants by contrast is more straight-forward without requiring you to think about the contents of each row to find the strategic row operations.
